page.title: 15Animals.
page.content: Local farms are mostly engaged in the rearing of animals. Calves are bred and reared before being sold south and sheep are also raised. The animals are often taken to Bakewell market for sale on Mondays, in cattle wagons or horse boxes. One farm on the hill leading out of Calver village (B.6001) keeps goats and advertises that both milk and cheese is for sale. Another animal which is frequently seen in the fields of the area is the horse or pony. It is the fashion to keep one for the children, and farmers find it an additional source of income. Wild animals include foxes, rabbits, squirrels, voles and badgers.
